title: Why do I see the meanings of the word that I say or think of? For example, if I say the word 'crap', I see an image of crap in my head. Is this normal? - Quora

response.answer_text: What exactly is normal anyway? Sometimes rare and unique is more interesting than the so called norm. Thinking in images is how some brains work. It’s not a defect, it's a cool, functioning tool! Have you taken a Myers-Briggs personality test before? Thinking in images has been linked to certain personality types. For example, it's not uncommon for someone with the INFJ personality type to see in images. (INFJ is the rarest Myers-Briggs personality type.) Maybe do some research into how the brain works. It really is a fascinating thing - that thing you have between your ears.
yes, it’s part of the magic of language. maybe you’re a poet
